channel.title: Just a simple question about linux vs. xp
channel.description:
Okay now I know that both have their own strong points but I want to ask something: what are the pros and cons of using linux and xp?I'm not thinking of switching but I want to know why is linux not marketing better than linux
Note now that I notice that this may appear in debates and discussion but since this is about linux I posted it here

item.title: Just a simple question about linux vs. xp
item.dc:creator: @ghostboy195 ghostboy195
item.description:
@ghostboy195 wrote:

OR... if your into waiting for about 2months, then you can order the latest stable version for free. absolutly free.

Read full topic

item.title: Just a simple question about linux vs. xp
item.dc:creator: @Wenakko Wenakko
item.description:
@Wenakko wrote:

Taylor:

[quote author=Wenakko link=topic=5548.msg58471#msg58471 date=1152212053]
[...]

i dont play games, i just browse forums, shoul i install linux?[/quote]

sure! if you are ready to learn some new.

http://www.ubuntu.com/desktop

see there. Download the live cd of ubuntu(the link at the bottom of the page), so you can test it, if you like it, then download the install cd's of ubuntu.

So you basicly boot from the livecd and you can test it. If you don't like it just take the cd off and you will be automatically booted to windows.

Read full topic
item.source: Just a simple question about linux vs. xp

item.title: Just a simple question about linux vs. xp
item.dc:creator: @Taylor Taylor
item.description:
@Taylor wrote:

Wenakko:

Facts:

-Well basicly linux is much faster than windows.
-Much safer, why? No one makes viruses(pointless), and viruses can't do anything unless you wont give them access to do. So by default they can't do anything.
-No need to defragment ur hdd partition, yes not at all! its because this doesent use fat32 or ntfs, mainly linux uses ext3, much benefits..
-Updated weekly.
-Much easier to install programs(if talking about ubuntu, and comparing to win)
-Much more programs for linux than windows (believe it, its true)

cons:
-Not really games (expect idsoftware:quake's etc.) But in future all gamingstudios will do like idsoftware: they are releasing the same game for win & linux and maybe for mac also.
-Can be hard to get support for hard trouble.
-Hardware's not well supported because hardware makers wont make linux drivers coz not so many uses linux, THO I dont have any hardware what wount work, mainly because I dont have any bling bling stuff (wireless, bluethoot, microsoft keyboards/mice and so on..)

So If you don't play games, and you dont have many bling bling hardware then INSTALL LINUX

i dont play games, i just browse forums, shoul i install linux?

Read full topic
item.source: Just a simple question about linux vs. xp

@Wenakko wrote:

Facts:

-Well basicly linux is much faster than windows.
-Much safer, why? No one makes viruses(pointless), and viruses can't do anything unless you wont give them access to do. So by default they can't do anything.
-No need to defragment ur hdd partition, yes not at all! its because this doesent use fat32 or ntfs, mainly linux uses ext3, much benefits..
-Updated weekly.
-Much easier to install programs(if talking about ubuntu, and comparing to win)
-Much more programs for linux than windows (believe it, its true)

cons:
-Not really games (expect idsoftware:quake's etc.) But in future all gamingstudios will do like idsoftware: they are releasing the same game for win & linux and maybe for mac also.
-Can be hard to get support for hard trouble.
-Hardware's not well supported because hardware makers wont make linux drivers coz not so many uses linux, THO I dont have any hardware what wount work, mainly because I dont have any bling bling stuff (wireless, bluethoot, microsoft keyboards/mice and so on..)

So If you don't play games, and you dont have many bling bling hardware then INSTALL LINUX

item.title: Just a simple question about linux vs. xp
item.dc:creator: @Ron Ron
item.description:
@Ron wrote:

the one:

whats unix?

Unix is an Operating System mainly used by companies or people testing things out. It's very uncommon for a consumer to use it. It's very secure but doesn't have the good stuff Linux has.

Read full topic

item.title: Just a simple question about linux vs. xp
item.dc:creator: @Ron Ron
item.description:
@Ron wrote:

Kryptizzler:

Personally, I find it easy to install programs on linux. You don't need to go around searching for a program, just open synaptic and type in what you want. There's over 18,000 programs in the Ubuntu repositories so that's a few to look through.

yeah I love thos ebuilt in ready to install programs. What I meant was if you don't find the program you're looking for on Ubuntu (I know that is almost impossible), then you need to download the file off the net and have to start writing commands in the terminal.

davidude36:

i heard linux was faster... but meh macs are usually faster.

You're right. Macs and Linux are based on Unix. But Macs are not based on Linux lol.

Linux and Unix and Macs are much faster because they aren't made out of crap liek Microsoft. Microsoft was coded so poorly that right after Windows XP was released, they had to dispatch a patch about a week later because there was a major security hole!

Uubuntu fits on a CD (700 MB) vursus Windows only fits on a DVD (it's about 2 GB or something maybe more).

Read full topic

item.title: Just a simple question about linux vs. xp
item.dc:creator: @Pwnd Pwnd
item.description:
@Pwnd wrote:

davidude36:

i heard linux was faster... but meh macs are usually faster.

Macs are good for game developement and graphics. It's a whole different processor/computer achitecture as well.

Linux has something that windows lacks, the reuse of libraries/core files that other apps use. So, windows uses more memory than it needs too.

item.title: Just a simple question about linux vs. xp
item.dc:creator: @Ron Ron
item.description:
@Ron wrote:

frank_:

a misconfigured linux box will probably be much more exploitable because windows generally wont let you modify all that much.

Windows will let you modify ANYTHING! I can delete the Windows drive if I wanted to. In Linux, they say "You're a dickhead" and then that prevents you from deleting anything vital for the Linux OS to run lol. WIndows will let you delete all the registry too. Or even... try going into command prompt and typing in "delete ." and your whole computer won't work. In Linux, it will again call you a name and won't let you do it lol.

~Ron

Read full topic

item.description:
@frank wrote:

also windows is much more open to viruses as windows is the dominant OS, so thats what virus makes aim for.

a misconfigured linux box will probably be much more exploitable because windows generally wont let you modify all that much.

and finally, linux is free!

item.source: Just a simple question about linux vs. xp

item.title: Just a simple question about linux vs. xp
item.dc:creator: @Ron Ron
item.description:
@Ron wrote:

Linux - Hard to hack

Windows - Easy to hack

Linux is not marketing better than Windows because Microsoft has a complete monopoly on computers and since that is true, 99% of all the software people make is for Microsoft only until it gets popular, then they consider recoding it for Linux, Unix, and/or Mac.

Linux is also not as popular because it is a lot complicated. Such as you have to type comands to install something. Like.. "sudo apt-get install asdasjkl" or something. While in XP you just have to double click on the .exe.

This is why most people have dual boot and use Linux to browse the net while using XP to use programs or play specific games.

~Ron

Read full topic
item.source: Just a simple question about linux vs. xp
